title: On graphs with chromatic number and maximum degree both equal to nine
abstract:
An equivalent version of the Borodin-Kostochka Conjecture, due to Cranston
and Rabern, says that any graph with $\chi = \Delta = 9$ contains $K_3 \lor
E_6$ as a subgraph. Here we prove several results in support of this
conjecture, where vertex-criticality and forbidden substructure conditions get
us either close or all the way to containing $K_3 \lor E_6$.
